Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We need to produce a final process tree model just the final structure describing the discovered process using operators SEQ XOR PARALLEL LOOP presumably They gave an example of process tree syntax with Operations like parallel sequence exclusive choice Actually they used operators A B tells that process tree A should be executed before the process tree B X A B tells exclusive choice between executing the process tree A or the process tree B A B tells true concurrency A B is a loop

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Given the event log we need to capture loops The repeated Request Missing Info RMI and re validation Validate Form VF after missing info suggests a loop that may be optional The process tree must capture main flow start with Receive Application RA Then Validate Form VF Then Assess Eligibility AE Some cases have an optional loop there may be a loop that goes back to either request missing info RMI or re validation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: A B is a loop So the process tree A is executed then either you exit the loop or you execute B and then A again this can happen several times until the loop is exited That suggests that the loop is defined by A B where after executing A you have an exclusive choice exit or execute B then go back to A So the loop can be seen as a cycle A B A

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Thus final process tree might be something like RA VF AE Loop RMI VF AD SC AC So we can represent this as an XOR choice Or as a loop of RMI and VF concurrently

Name: Validation - NE
Text: If we set A RMI B VF then RMI VF means execute RMI then either exit loop or execute VF and then go back to RMI That yields patterns like RMI VF RMI VF RMI etc which is not exactly what we see Actually we see sequences like AE RMI another RMI VF AD That suggests that after AE there can be multiple RMI events in a row but no VF between them Then after some RMI s they execute VF then AD So RMI VF cant capture multiple RMI in a row

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Alternatively maybe we can represent the loop as RMI tau where tau is a silent step representing continue That would allow repetitions of RMI and exit after any iteration after exiting loop go to VF That matches the observed pattern after some number of RMI s maybe zero they then do VF

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: To allow zero RMI s i e skip loop we need an exclusive choice between skip loop directly to AD or enter loop So perhaps the loop is optional via an XOR choice either directly go to AD or execute the loop RMI tau and then continue

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Thus the process tree may be RA VF AE XOR AD direct approve RMI tau optional loop of RMI repetitions VF after loop AD SC AC

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: We need a process tree that balances fitness precision and simplicity capturing these possible repetitions of requesting missing info and re validation as well as the main sequence of activities
